sen.j: 甘納豆（あまなっとう）は、豆類やクリ、ハスの実、サツマイモの輪切り(芋納豆と呼ばれる)などを砂糖漬けにした和菓子のひとつ。
sen.e: Amanatto, a Japanese-style cake, is candied beans, chestnuts, lotuses, and sweet potatoes cut into round slices (called Imo natto),
Amanatto, a Japanese-style cake, is candied beans, chestnuts, lotuses, and sweet potatoes cut into round slices (called Imo natto).
sen.cmt: 最後のカンマをピリオドに変更。
sen.e: Amanatto, a Japanese-style cake, is candied beans, chestnuts, lotuses, and sweet potatoes cut into round slices (called Imo natto).

sen.j: 納豆とは関連性がないが、一部混同される場合もある。
sen.e: It is not associated with natto but is sometimes confused with it.
It is not associated with natto but is sometimes confused with it.
It is not associated with natto but is sometimes confused with it.

sen.j: 近畿地方では、単に納豆と言えば甘納豆を指す場合もある。
sen.e: In the Kinki area, Amanatto can be simply called natto.
In the Kinki area, amanatto can be simply called natto.
In the Kinki area, amanatto can be simply called natto.

sen.j: 主な材料は、アズキ、ササゲ、エンドウマメ、ソラマメ、インゲンマメ。
sen.e: The main ingredients are small beans, black-eyed peas, peas, broad beans, and kidney beans.
The main ingredients are small beans, black-eyed peas, peas, broad beans, and kidney beans.
The main ingredients are small beans, black-eyed peas, peas, broad beans, and kidney beans.

sen.j: 最近ではウグイスマメなども用いられる。
sen.e: Sweetened boiled peas are also used these days.
sen.cmt: うぐいす豆とはえんどう豆の甘煮のことで、原料の豆のことではない、という説明を読みました。
sen.e: Sweetened boiled peas are also used these days.
Sweetened boiled peas are also used these days.

sen.j: これらを砂糖と共に甘く煮詰め、更に砂糖をまぶしてから乾燥させて作る。
sen.e: These are boiled down with sugar, sprinkled with sugar again, and dried.
These are boiled down with sugar, sprinkled with sugar again, and dried.
These are boiled down with sugar, sprinkled with sugar again, and dried.

sen.j: 1857年（安政4年）に榮太樓總本鋪が開発した。
sen.e: In 1857, the Eitaro Sohonnpo store started to make and sell Amanatto.
In 1857, the Eitaro Sohonnpo store started to make and sell amanatto.
In 1857, the Eitaro Sohonnpo store started to make and sell amanatto.

sen.j: 当初は納豆塩辛納豆（寺納豆）に似せて甘名納糖と名づけられ、第二次世界大戦後に簡略化されて甘納豆と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: At first, it was named Amana natto, similar to Shiokara natto (Tera natto), but it came to be called Amanatto for short after World War Ⅱ.
At first, it was named amana natto, similar to shiokara natto (tera natto), but it came to be called amanatto for short after World War II.
sen.cmt: 甘納豆の名前を小文字に変更
sen.e: At first, it was named amana natto, similar to shiokara natto (tera natto), but it came to be called amanatto for short after World War II.

sen.j: 北海道や山梨県には甘納豆を赤飯に入れる風習がある。
sen.e: In Hokkaido and Yamanashi Prefecture, it is a custom to use Amanatto for sekihan (festive red rice) instead of small beans.
In Hokkaido and Yamanashi Prefecture, it is a custom to use amanatto for sekihan (festive red rice) instead of small beans.
sen.cmt: 甘納豆の名前を小文字に変更
sen.e: In Hokkaido and Yamanashi Prefecture, it is a custom to use amanatto for sekihan (festive red rice) instead of small beans.

sen.j: 室町時代に甲斐国（山梨県）南部の人たちが移住した青森県の一部でもこの風習が残っている。
sen.e: This custom remains in part of Aomori Prefecture, into which some people from Southern Kai Province (Yamanashi Prefecture) moved in the Muromachi Period.
This custom remains in part of Aomori Prefecture, into which some people from Southern Kai Province (Yamanashi Prefecture) moved in the Muromachi Period.
This custom remains in part of Aomori Prefecture, into which some people from Southern Kai Province (Yamanashi Prefecture) moved in the Muromachi Period.
